definition.doc:
Any information on the sample.
This could include scanned variables that are associated with one of the data dimensions, e.g. the magnetic field, or logged data, e.g. monitored temperature vs elapsed time.

field.name: name
field.doc: Descriptive name of sample

field.name: chemical_formula
field.doc:
The chemical formula specified using CIF conventions. Abbreviated version of CIF standard:
* Only recognized element symbols may be used. * Each element symbol is followed by a 'count' number. A count of '1' may be omitted. * A space or parenthesis must separate each cluster of (element symbol + count). * Where a group of elements is enclosed in parentheses, the multiplier for the group must follow the closing parentheses. That is, all element and group multipliers are assumed to be printed as subscripted numbers. * Unless the elements are ordered in a manner that corresponds to their chemical structure, the order of the elements within any group or moiety depends on whether or not carbon is present. * If carbon is present, the order should be:
- C, then H, then the other elements in alphabetical order of their symbol. - If carbon is not present, the elements are listed purely in alphabetic order of their symbol. * This is the *Hill* system used by Chemical Abstracts.

field.name: temperature
field.doc: Sample temperature. This could be a scanned variable

field.name: electric_field
field.doc: Applied electric field

field.name: magnetic_field
field.doc: Applied magnetic field

field.name: stress_field
field.doc: Applied external stress field

field.name: pressure
field.doc: Applied pressure

field.name: changer_position
field.doc: Sample changer position

field.name: unit_cell_abc
field.doc: Crystallography unit cell parameters a, b, and c

field.name: unit_cell_alphabetagamma
field.doc: Crystallography unit cell parameters alpha, beta, and gamma

field.name: unit_cell
field.doc: Unit cell parameters (lengths and angles)

field.name: unit_cell_volume
field.doc: Volume of the unit cell

field.name: sample_orientation
field.doc:
This will follow the Busing-Levy convention:
W. R. Busing and H. A. Levy (1967). Acta Cryst. 22, 457-464

field.name: orientation_matrix
field.doc:
Orientation matrix of single crystal sample using Busing-Levy convention:
W. R. Busing and H. A. Levy (1967). Acta Cryst. 22, 457-464

field.name: ub_matrix
field.doc:
UB matrix of single crystal sample using Busing-Levy convention:
W. R. Busing and H. A. Levy (1967). Acta Cryst. 22, 457-464.
This is the multiplication of the orientation_matrix, given above, with the :math:`B` matrix which can be derived from the lattice constants.

field.name: mass
field.doc: Mass of sample

field.name: density
field.doc: Density of sample

field.name: relative_molecular_mass
field.doc: Relative Molecular Mass of sample

field.name: situation
field.doc: The atmosphere will be one of the components, which is where its details will be stored; the relevant components will be indicated by the entry in the sample_component member.

field.name: description
field.doc: Description of the sample

field.name: preparation_date
field.doc: Date of preparation of the sample

group.name: geometry
group.doc: The position and orientation of the center of mass of the sample
Details of beam incident on sample - used to calculate sample/beam interaction point
One group per sample component This is the perferred way of recording per component information over the n_comp arrays

field.name: component
field.doc: Details of the component of the sample and/or can

field.name: sample_component
field.doc: Type of component

field.name: concentration
field.doc: Concentration of each component

field.name: volume_fraction
field.doc: Volume fraction of each component

field.name: scattering_length_density
field.doc: Scattering length density of each component

field.name: unit_cell_class
field.doc: In case it is all we know and we want to record/document it

field.name: space_group
field.doc: Crystallographic space group

field.name: point_group
field.doc: Crystallographic point group, deprecated if space_group present

field.name: path_length
field.doc: Path length through sample/can for simple case when it does not vary with scattering direction

field.name: path_length_window
field.doc: Thickness of a beam entry/exit window on the can (mm). It is assumed to be the same for entry and exit

field.name: thickness
field.doc: sample thickness

field.name: sample_id
field.doc: Identification number or signatures of the sample used.

group.name: sample_history
group.doc: A descriptor to keep track of the treatment of the sample before entering the photoemission experiment. Ideally, a full report of the previous operations, in any format (NXnote allows to add pictures, audio, movies). Alternatively, a reference to the location or a unique identifier or other metadata file. In the case these are not available, free-text description

field.name: state
field.doc: Physical state of the sample

field.name: purity
field.doc: Chemical purity of the sample

field.name: orientation
field.doc: Surface termination of the sample (if crystalline)

field.name: layer
field.doc: Number of layers of the sample (e.g. bulk, monolayer, pentalayer, etc.)

field.name: chemical_name
field.doc: Full chemical name of the sample

field.name: chem_id_cas
field.doc: CAS registry number of the sample chemical content.

field.name: gas
field.doc: Gases might be fluxed on the surface for various reasons. Chemical designation, or residual.

field.name: gas_pressure
field.doc: In the case of a fixed pressure measurement this is the scalar pressure. In the case of an experiment in which pressure changes, or anyway is recorded, this is an array of length m of pressures.

field.name: surface_dopant
field.doc: Element of evaporated surface dopant such as alkali or other

field.name: surface_dopant_coverage
field.doc: Nominal thickness of the evaporated dopant

field.name: bias
field.doc: Voltage applied to sample and sample holder.

field.name: growth_method
field.doc: Sample growth method (e. g. molecular beam epitaxy, chemical vapor deposition etc.)

field.name: vendor
field.doc: Name of the sample vendor (company or research group)

field.name: substrate_material
field.doc: Material of the substrate in direct contact with the sample.

field.name: substrate_state
field.doc: Physical state of the substrate, similar options to sample_state

field.name: drain_current
field.doc: Current to neutralize the photoemission current. This field may also be found in NXmanpulator if present.

field.name: bias_voltage
field.doc: Possible bias of the sample with respect to analyser ground. This field may also be found as sample_bias in NXmanipulator if present.

group.name: temperature
group.doc: temperature.value is a link to e.g. temperature_env.sensor1.value

group.name: temperature_log
group.doc: temperature_log.value is a link to e.g. temperature_env.sensor1.value_log.value

group.name: magnetic_field
group.doc: magnetic_field.value is a link to e.g. magnetic_field_env.sensor1.value

group.name: magnetic_field_log
group.doc: magnetic_field_log.value is a link to e.g. magnetic_field_env.sensor1.value_log.value

field.name: external_DAC
field.doc: value sent to user's sample setup

group.name: external_ADC
group.doc: logged value (or logic state) read from user's setup

field.name: short_title
field.doc: 20 character fixed length sample description for legends

field.name: rotation_angle
field.doc: Optional rotation angle for the case when the powder diagram has been obtained through an omega-2theta scan like from a traditional single detector powder diffractometer

field.name: x_translation
field.doc: Translation of the sample along the X-direction of the laboratory coordinate system

field.name: distance
field.doc: Translation of the sample along the Z-direction of the laboratory coordinate system

group.doc: Any positioner (motor, PZT, ...) used to locate the sample

field.name: depends_on
field.doc: Refers to the last transformation specifying the positon of the manipulator in the NXtransformations chain.

group.doc: Collection of axis-based translations and rotations to describe the location and geometry of the manipulator as a component in the instrument. Conventions from the NXtransformations base class are used. In principle, the McStas coordinate system is used. The first transformation has to point either to another component of the system or . (for pointing to the reference frame) to relate it relative to the experimental setup. Typically, the components of a system should all be related relative to each other and only one component should relate to the reference coordinate system.

attribute.name: default
attribute.doc:
.. index:: plotting
Declares which child group contains a path leading to a :ref:`NXdata` group.
It is recommended (as of NIAC2014) to use this attribute to help define the path to the default dataset to be plotted. See https://www.nexusformat.org/2014_How_to_find_default_data.html for a summary of the discussion.
